level.text: Except as provided in chapters 20 through 25 of this title, in the CAP Overlay District, no building or premises shall be used and no building shall be erected or altered that is arranged, intended, or designed to be used except for one (1) or more of the uses listed in §§ 1201.2 through 1201.4.
The following uses shall be permitted as a matter of right:
In the CAP/R-4 Overlay District, any use permitted as a matter of right in the R-4 District;
In the CAP/R-5-B Overlay District, any use permitted as a matter of right in the R-5-B District;
In the CAP/SP Overlay District, any use permitted as a matter of right in the SP District; and
In the CAP/C-2-A and CAP/C-M-1 Overlay Districts, any use permitted as a matter of right in the C-2-A District, except that the following uses shall not be permitted:
Automobile laundry;
Automobile or truck sales;
Automobile rental agency;
Boat or other marine sales;
Drive-in restaurant;
Electric substation or natural gas regulator station;
Gasoline service station as an accessory use to a parking garage or public storage garage;
Installation of automobile accessories;
Parcel delivery service; and
(10) Parking lot, parking garage, or public storage garage.
The following uses shall be permitted if approved by the Board of Zoning Adjustment in accordance with the conditions specified in § 3104 for special exceptions and this section:
In the CAP/R-4 and CAP/R-5-B Overlay Districts, any use permitted as a special exception in those underlying districts, respectively, except that the following uses shall not be permitted:
Parking lot; provided, that a parking lot in existence on May 31, 1985 may continue subject to the special exception provisions of the underlying zone;
Public utility pumping station
Storage of wares and goods on an alley lot; and
Telephone exchange.
In the CAP/SP Overlay District, any use permitted as a special exception in the SP District, except that the following uses shall not be permitted:
Parking lot or parking garage;
Public utility pumping station; and
Telephone exchange.
In the CAP/C-2-A Overlay District, any use permitted as a special exception in the C-2-A District, except that the following uses shall not be permitted:

Gasoline service station; provided, that a gasoline service station existing on May 31, 1985 may be remodeled, repaired, or replaced subject to the special exception provisions of the underlying zone;
Motorcycle sales and repairs; and
Public utility pumping station.
Accessory uses and accessory buildings customarily incidental to the uses otherwise authorized by this section shall be permitted.
